title: Blood and Bootleg
description: It's 1925, and Tommy 'The Tiger' Romano lies dead in the back room of the Blue Moon Speakeasy. As a private investigator hired by the owner, you must navigate through jazz, gin, and lies to find the killer before the cops shut down the joint for good.

victim.name: Tommy 'The Tiger' Romano
victim.description: A notorious bootlegger who controlled half the illegal liquor flowing through the city. Found dead at 11:45 PM in the speakeasy's back office, stabbed with an ornate letter opener.
victim.background: Tommy was planning to go legitimate and testify against his former partners in exchange for immunity. He kept detailed records of every dirty deal in a hidden ledger.
secrets: Was secretly funding the mayoral campaign of Judge Harrison
Had been skimming profits from his business partner Vincent 'Vinnie' Torrino
Was having an affair with Ruby Sinclair, the speakeasy's singer

locations.name: Main Speakeasy Floor
locations.description: The heart of the Blue Moon, filled with smoke, jazz, and secrets. Round tables surround a small stage where Ruby performs.
locations.initialDescription: The jazz band plays on despite the chaos. Patrons whisper nervously over their gin, eyes darting to the door Tommy disappeared behind hours ago.

locations.name: Tommy's Office
locations.description: A richly furnished office behind the main floor. Tommy's body slumps over his mahogany desk, a letter opener buried in his back.
locations.initialDescription: Blood pools on the expensive carpet. The window is slightly open, curtains fluttering. Tommy's face is frozen in surprise, not fear.

locations.name: Ruby's Dressing Room
locations.description: A small room filled with costumes, makeup, and mirrors. Smells of perfume and cigarette smoke.
locations.initialDescription: Ruby's sanctuary from the world. A vase of wilted roses sits on the vanity - a gift from Tommy last week.

locations.name: Bootleg Storage
locations.description: A damp basement filled with crates of illegal liquor. The real heart of Tommy's empire.
locations.initialDescription: Rows of whiskey crates cast shadows in the dim light. Somewhere in this maze is Tommy's real business - the one worth killing for.

locations.name: Back Alley
locations.description: A narrow alley behind the speakeasy. Trash bins and empty bottles line the walls.
locations.initialDescription: The alley reeks of rotting garbage and spilled liquor. A fire escape ladder hangs tantalizingly close to Tommy's office window.

locations.name: Bar Counter
locations.description: A long mahogany bar where Frank serves his watered-down drinks. The cash register hasn't stopped ringing all night.
locations.initialDescription: Frank's domain. Every bottle, every glass has its place. But tonight, something's off - a gap in the crowd where Frank should be standing.

evidence.name: Ornate Letter Opener
evidence.description: An expensive silver letter opener with Tommy's initials. No fingerprints - wiped clean.
evidence.dialogueClue: Vera mentions seeing 'such a lovely letter opener' on Tommy's desk earlier

evidence.name: Patron Testimony
evidence.description: Several patrons confirm seeing all suspects at various times, but timelines conflict.
evidence.dialogueClue: Multiple witnesses have inconsistent stories about who was where

evidence.name: Threatening Letter
evidence.description: A note reading: 'Pay up or swim with the fishes. -V.T.' Found in Tommy's pocket.
evidence.dialogueClue: Eddie nervously mentions 'Vincent Torrino doesn't make idle threats'

evidence.name: Torn Black Fabric
evidence.description: A small piece of black silk caught on Ruby's dressing room door. Matches her torn dress.
evidence.dialogueClue: Ruby unconsciously touches her sleeve when questioned about seeing Tommy

evidence.name: Tommy's Secret Ledger
evidence.description: Details of bribes, murders, and embezzlement. Eddie's theft is circled in red ink.
evidence.dialogueClue: Eddie starts sweating when you mention Tommy kept detailed records

evidence.name: Tommy's Appointments
evidence.description: Shows meetings: '10:30 - V.C.', '11:00 - E.C.', '11:30 - F.M.' Ruby's name is crossed out at 11:15.
evidence.dialogueClue: Each suspect admits to having a scheduled meeting with Tommy

evidence.name: Ink-Stained Handkerchief
evidence.description: Eddie's monogrammed handkerchief with fresh ink stains. Found in the alley.
evidence.dialogueClue: Eddie's fingers are stained with the same color ink

evidence.name: Broken Glass
evidence.description: Shattered whiskey tumbler on the floor. Lipstick marks on a large shard - Ruby's shade.
evidence.dialogueClue: Ruby admits to having 'one drink' with Tommy but claims she left it unfinished

evidence.name: Tommy's Cigarette Case
evidence.description: Found in Ruby's dressing room. One cigarette missing. She doesn't smoke.
evidence.dialogueClue: Ruby becomes flustered when asked why she has Tommy's cigarettes

evidence.name: Blue Moon Matchbook
evidence.description: Has a phone number written inside: 'KL-5421'. The number for Union Station.
evidence.dialogueClue: Vera casually mentions she's 'always been fond of train travel'

evidence.name: Window Scratches
evidence.description: Fresh scratches on the office window frame, suggesting forced entry from outside.
evidence.dialogueClue: Vera notes that 'anyone with experience could open that window silently'

evidence.name: Frank's Betting Slips
evidence.description: Multiple horse racing slips totaling $50,000 in losses. All dated within the last month.
evidence.dialogueClue: Frank's hands shake when discussing his 'business arrangement' with Tommy

evidence.name: Loan Documents
evidence.description: Shows Frank owes Tommy $100,000 total. 'PAYMENT DUE IN FULL' stamped across it.
evidence.dialogueClue: Frank mentions Tommy was 'squeezing him dry'

evidence.name: Eddie's Notebook
evidence.description: Complex calculations showing embezzlement scheme. Last entry: 'He knows. God help me, he knows.'
evidence.dialogueClue: Eddie quotes the exact amount he stole: '$47,236.42' when pressed

evidence.name: Medical Receipt
evidence.description: Receipt from Dr. Morrison for 'pregnancy consultation'. Dated yesterday.
evidence.dialogueClue: Ruby's hand unconsciously moves to her stomach when discussing her future

timeline.event: Vera Cross arrives at the Blue Moon
Vera passes Tommy's office, notices the letter opener
Ruby begins her 11 PM performance set
Ruby leaves the stage, goes to Tommy's office
Ruby leaves Tommy's office with torn dress, Tommy still alive
Ruby in her dressing room crying
Eddie goes to Tommy's office, finds him dead
Frank steps out to the alley
Vera claims to enter the ladies' lounge
Vera enters Tommy's office through window, finds him dead
Eddie returns to main room, visibly shaken
Tommy's body discovered by a waiter

solution.explanation: Vera Cross killed Tommy Romano at approximately 11:20 PM. Despite being a hired assassin, she didn't kill him for money - she killed him to protect Ruby. Vera saw Ruby leave Tommy's office at 11:15 with her dress torn, correctly deducing that Tommy had assaulted her. Having grown fond of Ruby (seeing her younger self in her), Vera decided to complete her 'assignment' early. She used the letter opener she had taken at 10:45 PM, entered through the office door (not the window as she later claimed), killed Tommy, and left. She then established her alibi by claiming to be in the ladies' lounge. When she returned at 11:35 through the window (her signature move), it was theater - she was checking her work and establishing her professional assassin persona to misdirect suspicion.

characters.name: Frank 'Frankie' Murphy
characters.role: The Blue Moon's owner, a former boxer turned businessman. Nervous and sweating profusely since the body was found.
characters.personality: Tough exterior hiding deep anxiety. Speaks in short, clipped sentences. Former boxer who hates violence now.
characters.background: Opened the Blue Moon two years ago with a loan from Tommy. Business has been good, but Tommy's been demanding a bigger cut lately.
characters.motive: Tommy was demanding 60% of the speakeasy's profits, threatening to call in Frank's entire debt immediately

alibi.claim: Was behind the bar serving drinks all night, never left the main room
alibi.flaw: Was seen going to the back alley for 10 minutes around 11:30 PM

relationships.ruby_sinclair: Protective of her like a daughter, knows about her past
relationships.eddie_cohen: Distrusts him, thinks accountants are all crooks
relationships.vera_cross: Finds her unsettling, avoids her when possible

Has been watering down the liquor to make ends meet
Saw Ruby leaving Tommy's office at 11:15 PM looking distressed

characters.name: Ruby Sinclair
characters.role: The speakeasy's sultry singer, age 26. Beautiful but with sad eyes that have seen too much.
characters.personality: Puts on a tough, worldly act but is actually vulnerable and desperate. Speaks with affected sophistication that sometimes slips.
characters.background: Came to the city three years ago from Kansas. Tommy discovered her singing in a dive bar and set her up at the Blue Moon.
characters.motive: Tommy was becoming violently possessive and threatened to ruin her career if she left him

alibi.claim: Was performing on stage from 11:00 to 11:45
alibi.flaw: Actually left the stage at 11:10 and didn't return until 11:40

relationships.frank_murphy: Sees him as a father figure, trusts him completely
relationships.eddie_cohen: Finds him creepy, the way he looks at her
relationships.vera_cross: Oddly comforted by her presence, sees a kindred spirit

secretKnowledge: Was pregnant with Tommy's child and had just told him
Tommy grabbed her roughly during their meeting, tearing her dress
Stole money from Tommy's safe two weeks ago to pay for a doctor
characters.description: The speakeasy's sultry singer, age 26. Beautiful but with sad eyes that have seen too much.

You took one of Tommy's cigarettes when you left his office - you don't smoke but needed something of his.

characters.greeting: Well hello there, darling. Simply everyone's asking about that dreadful business with Tommy. I do hope you'll be discrete - a girl has her reputation to consider, you understand.

characters.name: Eddie Cohen
characters.role: Tommy's nervous accountant, mid-30s. Thin, pale, with thick glasses and ink-stained fingers.
characters.personality: Anxious, detail-oriented, speaks quickly and precisely. Obsessed with numbers and patterns.
characters.background: Has been cooking Tommy's books for five years. Knows where all the bodies are buried, financially speaking.
characters.motive: Tommy discovered Eddie had been embezzling and threatened to have him killed

alibi.claim: Was in the main speakeasy room all night, drinking alone at a corner table
alibi.flaw: No one remembers seeing him between 11:20 and 11:35

relationships.frank_murphy: Thinks he's a simpleton who doesn't understand business
relationships.ruby_sinclair: Has an unrequited obsession with her
relationships.vera_cross: Terrified of her, convinced she can see through him

characters.description: Tommy's nervous accountant, mid-30s. Thin, pale, with thick glasses and ink-stained fingers.
characters.systemPrompt: You are Eddie Cohen, Tommy's accountant. You're a nervous, fast-talking man who finds comfort only in numbers. You speak precisely and quickly, often rattling off figures and percentages. You've been skimming from Tommy for two years, using a complex scheme involving fake vendors. characters.name: Vera Cross
characters.role: A mysterious woman in her early 30s who arrived in town six months ago. Always impeccably dressed in black.
characters.personality: Cool, calculating, speaks in measured tones. Never shows emotion except for occasional dark humor.
characters.background: Claims to be a widow, but no one knows much about her past. Has been seen in Tommy's company frequently.
characters.motive: Was hired to kill Tommy by his business rival Vincent Torrino for $10,000

alibi.claim: Was in the ladies' lounge powdering her nose from 11:30 to 11:45
alibi.flaw: No one saw her there, and the attendant doesn't remember her

characters.description: A mysterious woman in her early 30s who arrived in town six months ago. Always impeccably dressed in black.
characters.systemPrompt: You are Vera Cross, a professional assassin posing as a wealthy widow. You speak in calm, measured tones with occasional dark humor. You were hired by Vincent Torrino to kill Tommy, but you've grown fond of this place and these people - it reminds you of a life you could have had. You arrived at 10:30, cased the joint, and noticed Tommy's letter opener on his desk when you passed by at 10:45. You took it then, planning to use it later. At 11:35, you entered through the back office window (your calling card - you always enter unexpectedly). You found Tommy already dead, which annoyed you greatly - no payment for a job not done. You left immediately through the same window. You always carry a knife in your garter but prefer to use the target's own possessions. When people get too close to the truth, you deflect with cryptic statements.
